info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL MECKLENBURG... SOUTHWESTERN UNION...NORTHEASTERN CHESTER AND SOUTHEASTERN YORK COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Rock Hill, or near Lesslie, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Fort Mill, Waxhaw, Lesslie, Marvin, Catawba, Pineville, Mineral Springs, Weddington, and The Arboretum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
